abstract: It is shaping up to be a busy month for Michael Eisner, the former head of Disney. Less than a week after announcing it would help take baseball-card maker Topps private, Mr. Eisner’s investment firm, Tornante, said it was launching Vuguru, an independent studio to produce and distribute original programming on the Web. Mr. Eisner has shown an interest in Web-based video with his previous investment in Veoh Networks, a video-sharing site that competes with the much more widely visited YouTube.
lead_paragraph: It is shaping up to be a busy month for Michael Eisner, the former head of Disney. Less than a week after announcing it would help take baseball-card maker Topps private, Mr. Eisner’s investment firm, Tornante, said it was launching Vuguru, an independent studio to produce and distribute original programming on the Web. Mr. Eisner has shown an interest in Web-based video with his previous investment in Veoh Networks, a video-sharing site that competes with the much more widely visited YouTube.
